website_summaries.verdict: Gets the job done with a low price and installation anyone can accomplish.
pros: Comes with a remote control for dimmer and timer options
Can be turned on and off by simply tapping the light
cons: These are battery operated and cannot be hard wired
Not great if you want to leave the lighting on all the time or overnight

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Using eneloop rechargeable batteries and I am still getting horrible results. Maybe I got a bad lot of puck lights. I really wanted them to work but I think I am going to return them. The lights drain batteries like I have never seen before. Fresh alkaline batteries last about 3-5 hours before they start to die or get dim. Eneloops fear no better and have a full life of about 10 hours. I am using these light about 15-30 min at a time. They are good for emergency use.
customer_reviews.author: A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Eats through batteries in days.
customer_reviews.text: These lights are terrible. I've used both regular AA batteries and rechargeable batteries. I use the lights over the sink while I'm doing dishes. The light is bright for about 1-2 days of a half hour use maybe twice a day. By 5 days the light is barely on and does nothing. It is ridiculous how often the batteries need to be changed in the things. The ONLY positive is the remote works well. I am now shopping for new lights. I think I'll stick with ones that plug in.
customer_reviews.author: Janet S.

customer_reviews.title: Ok......
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED 9-4-17 these are just awful. I have literally used these only 7 times and the batteries are all dead. Only 2 of those times were they on for extended period of time. At this rate I will be going through batteries weekly. Very disappointed. These are ok. They provide good under the counter lights when it is dark at night. I was looking for something to provide me with more light during the in between afternoon and evening times when the sun isn't quite down yet. These do not give me enough light to meet my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Trina P.

customer_reviews.title: Batteries don't last in these lights.
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was great. Product appearance was great. Installation was easy and took minimal time. The problem is that these things KILL batteries!! The batteries that came with them lasted about two days. Each puck light takes (3) AA batteries. I figured that I would need to replace the cheap batteries that came with it fairly quickly and that a good set of batteries would make a difference............that wasn't the case. I purchased and installed Duracell batteries. They didn't last either. If you plan on using these things for 15 minutes a week.......it will be a good purchase for you. If you plan on using them everyday.......you should probably look at a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Len August

customer_reviews.title: Eats through batteries- don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Drains batteries way too fast. I’ve had to replace batteries every two weeks to keep these bright. I wish I could return them because I’ve basically let the batteries run out and didn’t replace them because it’s too expensive and wasteful to replace the batteries that frequently. Really disappointed because they are great when they’re bright.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brechwald

customer_reviews.title: The remote is easily understood and the timer function is neat
customer_reviews.text: We installed these under our cabinets with the included sticky tape. The remote is easily understood and the timer function is neat. Only issue we have is one of our lights no longer works. When batteries are installed they get really hot. We have owned them for a couple weeks now and use them on occasion. Each light uses three AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Battery Drainers
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. They were great at first but they drain batteries like crazy. I replaced the ones they came with only 2 days after I installed them thinking they probably just weren't very good batteries to begin with. Nope! The new batteries are already almost fully drained and I have only had them on for about 12 hours. Guess I'll be buying the hard wired ones soon so I know I won't be wasting my money.
customer_reviews.author: brook

customer_reviews.title: I bought these lights and they worked great. For a day
customer_reviews.text: I bought these lights and they worked great. For a day. They were so dim, I thought they were not on the correct settings. I changed the batteries to expensive batteries thinking that was the issue. They lasted great, again for one day. I would not recommend these unless you plan on only using them once.
customer_reviews.author: Tomlo

customer_reviews.title: Really Wanted to Love These...
customer_reviews.text: I loved these lights when I first put them up about a month ago. They were exactly what I wanted for my dim apartment kitchen, and they were so easy to put up. However, they have started to get darker after only one month of light use. It is irritating as I typically use three more frequently than the others, so they are noticeably darker now than the other ones. While they may not be working the way I expected them, they are a good option for renters who can't do permanent installs and are reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: hillary

customer_reviews.title: Lights are great with one issue...
customer_reviews.text: We were very happy with the lights when we first installed them. Very bright and stayed up with sticky adhesive pads. We really love the remote and the dimming feature. However, we are having an issue with lights coming on at random times. It started with 2 in opposite corners that would be on if we walked in the room without anyone touching them or the remote. Now we have it happening with 2 more. Not sure what that’s about but it’s a bit annoying since it means wasting battery life.
customer_reviews.author: shannon7708

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: These were such a disappointment. I cannot remember ordering something the turned out to be such a waste of money. They initially worked, however the lights wouldn’t all turn on with one click. I had to click the on button multiple times, then more and more before some wouldn’t turn on at all — this happened over the course of a month. By the time some didn’t turn on, the ones that did work started to fall because the adhesive detached. I would not buy this product again and I wish I had returned them when I could
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: I received basically a plastic garbage bag with 7 lights in it
customer_reviews.text: Very strange. I received basically a plastic garbage bag with 7 lights in it, 20 batteries (over 1/2 were already dead-I have a battery tester) 6 screws (so enough for 3 lights) also just thrown in the big garbage bag, no separate bag AND no tape as others described for installation. 3 lights had yellowing tape stuck all over them, I spent 20 minutes with goo-be-gone wiping that off. When I finally make it to the store to buy screws, working batteries and tape I hope these are better than the first impression. I might just return them as I am a little off put by the delivery and condition, have some pride in your items!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my remodeled kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I just remodeled my kitchen and wanted lights under my cabinets to give it a cozy feel. I wanted something easy to install but effective. These lights are great! You can adjust the brightness and can even put them on a timer so they turn off on their own after 15, 30, or 60 minutes. They come with a sticky tape to attach to cabinets but I also added sticky back velcro and they have stayed on perfectly. The company sent me an email offering any assistance if I should need it. I absolutely LOVE them and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa CoreyTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Dark Closest - No Problem
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these lites because we have a standard, old-school closet and it's very hard to see in the back left and right hand corners. Before hiring an electrician and incurring that large cost to install a light, we thought this was worth the couple of dollars. We were amazed how beautifully they've worked. Likes: 1. Ease of installation. 2. How many come in a package, and better yet with batteries - wow! 3. That there is a remote. Dislikes: 1. Wish there was a way of keeping the very small remote safely somewhere. Possibly with some velcro, which could be included.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Sutherlin

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic but don’t all necessarily last
customer_reviews.text: These were the best things ever. Until about 2 weeks in one light no longer lights except at the lowest level. Makes it useless. I’d love a replacement from the vendor. Aside from now only having 2 lights they’re great. Being able to dim them, have them on a timer, or even turn one on by pushing it. Great and recommend EXCEPT that you may expect to lose actual functionality of 1 or more. Also the adhesive strips provided only held 1 on the cabinet; had to screw in hard to hold them. Ouch! Would truly love a replacement! then 5/4 stars pretty much overall.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Instal and use- immediate improvement
customer_reviews.text: So I havent tested the longevity and i may update this revew later but i immedately added this product again to my cart after installing it in my kitchen and i felt like shouting for joy. I am so thrilled- so easy, works so much better than expected, so easy to install and use and even has a dim function. If my husband wasnt in a zoom meeting i would drag his butt to come to see it. I can't wait to use this in closets, pantries, bookshelves, ...the ideas are endless. Super glad i got this. Even if i had to change the batteries once a month it would be worth it....we shall see how good the longevity is
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: NOT A FAKE REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: I live in what used to be my grandparents' house. 1955. One closet has a wired light. I'm not sure why they stopped at one but I have another closet that's darker than - well, I don't know what it's darker than because it's SO DARK! These lights have saved me. Saved me from wearing navy Skechers with black pants. Saved me from the giant man-eating spider that I'm sure would have devoured me had I not turned on these lights. Contrary to other reviewers, I have not been plagued by the ghost lights that turn off and on at will. I've only experienced their glorious light, bathing my closet in a life-saving glow. And the remote's pretty handy too.
customer_reviews.author: TrixieFink

customer_reviews.title: Randomly go on and off on their own.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for a few different areas. We put them under our kitchen cabinets, and a few on top. We were very happy initially, when we saw how bright they were. Also the remote has a setting to put them on at 50%. Well after the first night... we had them on the timer for 120 min. They went off as scheduled. But the next morning, they started to come on and go off all by themselves. After almost a week, they still are randomly coming on. But seem to be staying off longer. I am sure the batteries are being drained by this happening. A little disappointed,as we were really excited to use these.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, nice warm light
customer_reviews.text: Long story short, wife wanted under cabinet lighting, I didn't want to run wires, bought these things just to see if they would suffice, they totally did. Saved myself a few hundred bucks. Basically had them out of the box and up and running within 3 minutes, no bs! The only bad thing is you have to have the remote pointed in the general direction of the light, so all lights won't turn on at once. However the lights are super responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Coleman

customer_reviews.title: These are worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: With these lights, in short order, you'll be able to have the under-cabinet lights that you've always wanted. They are a breeze to install; even I could do it. One important thing to note: they include some tiny screws that are meant to be used to fasten the light to the surface. Please don't overlook them, and by all means, use them. I tried to fasten the lights using only the 3M adhesive patch, and it doesn't hold them securely. They include a nifty remote to dim the lights and also to put them on a timer if you'd like. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: adwhiz

customer_reviews.title: Poor Double Sided Tape!
customer_reviews.text: The product comes with screws or double sided tape. Being a renter I was not able to use the screws. After less than 1 week of use the double sided tape separated so half was stuck to the underside of the cabinet and the other half to the led light. This caused the light to fall off the underside of the cabinet. Tried using command strips and it helps however still doesn’t work as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: M. Fields

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed!
customer_reviews.text: Love love these lights! I just got a new shed to use as a home gym. I decided to add lighting so that I can workout at night or early before sunrise. I searched for about an hour for the perfect lighting system and I made the right choice. The shed is a 12.5x8. I ordered one 6-pack and the lighting is PERFECT! I love the remote because I have it in the pouch that hangs on the door so I can power on the lights before I step in. My kids think they can camp out in there at night now lol! I highly recommend this set, I’m happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: A. P.

customer_reviews.title: do not but this waste of a "product
customer_reviews.text: I can't say this strongly enough... do not buy this waste of a "product." I should have heeded the previous review that stated these lights go to 50% after one day. It's totally accurate! I installed these under my cabinets and now i have to start over. I have had under cabinet lighting in two of my previous homes. Both were battery operated, just like these were supposed to be. But these lost their useful lighting in one day!!!!! Seriously, why would one day of use diminish the lighting capabilities of under cabinet lighting? DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!! IT'S A TOTAL RIPOFF. Go to your local Home Depot or Lowes or whatever to get some decent under cabinet lighting.
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and Cute! Economical lights that are easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Loved the easy installation Love the fact that you can adjust the lighting. Works several feet away (packaging says 15 feet) Love the remote and that you can also tap to on/off. I took this picture with the kitchen lights off and the intensity at 100%. I place my lights on an angle so that I can power on/off from the kitchen (just an FYI) You might not be standing straight in front of it so whatever angle is more convenient for you. Gives off just the right amount of light. Worth the money and super cute!
customer_reviews.author: blssdnfvrd1

customer_reviews.title: Drains the battery so fast
customer_reviews.text: The lights were extremely easy to install and the remotes works well, but it drains batteries so fast! The original batteries it came with were dead within a couple weeks with only about an hour or so of use a day, I thought maybe it was just the cheap batteries it came with so I changed them out with some high end batteries and same result. Batteries dying after very minimal use. And it requires A LOT of batteries to change them all out (3 per light).
customer_reviews.author: Kail N.

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: The advertising and video associated with this product are extremely misleading. I would call it fraudulent. The lights are fine. However there are no batteries included which the video would otherwise indicate and there was no remote control, which the video also indicated. Maybe it was in the small print. But I have to purchase 9 AA batteries and remote unit to get the full product I expected. This is false advertising and I would expect it's against the law.
customer_reviews.author: tas67

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick, it's not going to replace hardwired lights, though.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used for long but so far they've worked great. I don't plan on using this for under cabinet lighting as I'm concerned about battery life, but for smaller jobs where constant lighting isn't as important it'll do the trick. As for other reviews just temper expectations, it's a light running on 3 AA batteries for goodness sakes.. I'll update if anything changes!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Stay away. In fact, stay away from all battery powered under counter lights. In a week the lights were not as bright. In 2 weeks 1 light no longer worked at all, new batteries didn't fix it. By week 3, two lights no longer worked at all and I was cursing ripping them down and throwing them in the trash. If you want under counter lights for your kitchen find something with a cord and plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Morano

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our kitchen. They are very easy to install. The remote has separate on/off buttons that makes it easier to get all of them on/off at one time. They are dimmable and the light they put off is nice. They also have 15/30/60/120 minute timer options. My only 2 complaints....1. Battery life. They take 3 AA batteries each. If you use them daily, expect to replace the batteries weekly. I also wish they were a little more low profile. Right now it's easy to see the lights when they're off.
customer_reviews.author: M. Richey

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly as pictured in description/pictures.
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited about these lights based on the pictures of how bright they are and how wide of a area they cover. I bought 6 - 2 for under each set of cupboards. Unfortunately, they aren't as bright nor do they carry light as far as described. I did mount these in the middle of the cabinets. If I had to do it over again, I'd place them at the front of the cabinets (although still underneath) so they did cover a tad more space.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: So easy, works great
customer_reviews.text: I installed 6 of these under my upper cabinets in 10 minutes. I wish they were even brighter, but they will definitely solve the problem that occurs when I am working at the counter and my body casts a shadow from the overhead light onto my work area. The remote is tiny and works great. When I hold it at the correct angle, it turns all lights on or off at the same time. Is my angle is off, you just re-aim and click again. If you only want one light, you can easily turn on and off manually. I love these so much I am ordering 6 more.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Payne

customer_reviews.title: Bright and Compact
customer_reviews.text: Using these lights on queen size bunk beds where wiring lights was not possible. One light for each bed is enough to read by. The dim feature is not possible when using the light as a "tap" light; meaning individually without the remote. When we installed these, the remote did not work for all four because they were too separated from each other. The remote did work though if we pointed it at each individual light and we could dim, brighten, turn on and off. Since we did not plan on using the remote this is not an issue for us. The lights do provide excellent illumination in either dim or bright.
customer_reviews.author: JLH

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive undercabinet lighting
customer_reviews.text: Having only had these installed for 2 days it is still too early to evaluate battery life. Brightness is adequate. No idea what the motion detection refers above refers to. I bought a 6x pack and a 3x pack as I needed 9. I was disappointed to find that the 3x pack do not respond to the remote control. Wish that had been evident when I was buying them. Also, just from my usage, the timer settings are basically useless. I can't forsee a scenario where I would want them on for more the 15 minutes. I didn't buy them to replace my overhead lighting. For my purposes, settings of 5 minutes, 10 minutes and 15 minutes would be better.
customer_reviews.author: bill cannon

customer_reviews.title: Bright as puck....and great price too!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to put in a new wooden display case. These are very bright. Fairly low profile so mounting on the underside of the shelves allowed them to not be so visible. Only con I have found was that I was hoping to be able to turn all the lights on at once, but I have to point the control at each puck to turn them off and on individually. Not a deal breaker by any means. Brightness and battery life more than make up for that. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steven T.

customer_reviews.title: Camper Helper
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these to give us some portable lighting at out campsite. Some are in our camper, some are outside on tables (near the cooler, bug spray, etc.), and some are in our screen tent where we eat and play games. They are bright, as you would expect LED lights to be. Not as bright as the LED lights we installed in our camper lamps, but more than bright as supplemental lights. Very pleased with how well they work for the price. The remote is a really cool feature - I love that we can adjust the level of the lighting and turn all on or off with a click. Truly happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: Greg and Sara Masarik

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Not
customer_reviews.text: These are worthless. This seller is great and really endeavored to get this right for me, but this product is not a good one. The lights and brightness are hit-or-miss. The first box had only 3 of 6 that had functional brightness (the lit -- but the brightness was so dim). The replacement, at no cost to me, had no lights that shed enough light and brightness to use effectively. I will say the remote...genius. There is a dimmer (and no, these were not on 'dim'), a timer, and just the great opportunity to have a light on downstairs in the mudroom and then turn it off upstairs. Brilliant. Just wish the lights were quality otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. M.

customer_reviews.title: 100 hour battery life is false!
customer_reviews.text: The lights are bright, and the remote works flawlessly, but these lights WILL NOT last 100 hours! Not even close. I used the best and most expensive batteries (energizer lithium) and still only got about a solid 16-20 hours of bright lights before they went completely dull and began shutting off around 25-28 hours. I did test them out at 100% and I’m sure you’ll get more at 50%, but that would take you up to max 50 hours based on my results. They really need to change that wording in the description.
customer_reviews.author: J.O.

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! They come with adhesives and screws so they won’t come off and it comes with all of the batteries so you don’t have to go out and buy a ton of them. The lights are bright and adjustable. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: AlexS

customer_reviews.title: Five stars except for horrible battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these except for the battery problem. I rarely use them and it eats batteries like there is no tomorrow. I suspect the problem lies with the fact that they are in standby mode all the time looking for the remote signal. You cannot fully turn them off. If I put in new batteries they will be dead in a couple of months with only a few hours of light usage (we only turn them on when we are eating in the dining room which is rare). All six that I installed have exactly the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Culture

customer_reviews.title: Handy Bright Lights, but Battery Hogs.
customer_reviews.text: These LED lights are simple to install. Just choose a location and screw them in or stick them on. That’s it. The remote works well and offers some nice features for brightness levels and and timers. They’re bright and worked as we hoped. Each light takes three AA batteries. For our set of three, that’s nine batteries. In our experience they lasted about three months, only turning them on with the 60 minute timer while making dinner a few days per week. Consider the battery usage and if you’re good with that, I can give my recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: If you need dependable lights, these are not the droids you are looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I suppose this is a case of "You get what you pay for". I was very disappointed in these lights. I placed them in a metal storage cabinet, on vertical and horizontal surfaces (horizontal was over head, with the light inverted) using the included adhesive mounting squares. Some of the lights repeatedly fell off. The batteries died at inconstant rates, even though they were all used at the same time, every time. They started failing within less than 20 minutes of cumulative use. These were used for 1-3 minutes at a time. The temperature range they were in was maintained around 75 degrees F.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THESE ARE GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I prefer a cool light for kitchen tasks so I ended up buying another product for under my cabinets. But we liked these so much we decided to keep them, too. I put them on TOP of my upper kitchen cabinets for warm, dimmable ambient lighting, and also to provide light in case of power failures. They have to be switched on/off individually, but the remote makes that a cinch! I don't need it in my application, but these have a timer with the motion detector so they go off automatically to save the batteries, WHICH WERE INCLUDED.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hue issue differs with batches
customer_reviews.text: So I bought these for my kitchen and realized I could use more. Ordered from same seller, same everything and when the second order came in the lighting was off, first batch of lights give off a clean white hue, second batch gave off a beige hue, it was noticeable right away, so now I can’t use them for the kitchen and I need more but I’m afraid I won’t know if the color will be correct. For the record there is one color choice to choose from, so the lights look fabulous but I’m disappointed the second batch didn’t match.
customer_reviews.author: StarrySkye

customer_reviews.title: bright enough for over cook top
customer_reviews.text: My new Hood, over the cooktop worked great for a couple weeks... but then the lights went out. my handyman managed to fix this 2 more times, but he thinks the connection vibrates when the fan is on, and then must not make a good connection. The fan works. So, I purchased these lights to put over [inside the hood] and next to the cook top. So far they work great. Getting a relacement hood wasn't an option as it was costly to have one installed... and a bugger to get in. I'm happy with this solution to a frustrating problem...
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen S. Sowden

customer_reviews.title: Great lights for the cost
customer_reviews.text: So far after 1 week, I haven't found anything to dislike. Because I installed the lights under kitchen cabinets, they do not detect lots of motion but that's okay with me. One of the main reasons I bought these lights is because my daughter has chronic lyme disease and sometimes bright lights hurt her eyes and these lights satisfy both of us. I like rooms to be well-lit so eating in a darkened kitchen is not my favorite thing but using these lights along with the stove light and ambient light from the connected family room is a very good compromise.
customer_reviews.author: K DiPietro

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.  Bright enough for closets and under counter
customer_reviews.text: There's no external switch on these, you just push the lens inward to turn it on and again to turn it off, or use the remote (which I know I will lose within weeks). The self stick back on these things is never strong enough to hold it on the surface if you have to flip a switch, but these don't require it. Actually, every time you turn it on or off by pushing on the lens you're improving the adhesion. You should pre-clean the surface with some rubbing alcohol to remove any oily film that might be on the surface before installing
customer_reviews.author: Dave D.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have been toying with the idea of under cabinet lighting for a while. The bottom of our cabinets are recessed, so I knew these would be invisible. I wanted soft, dimmable light to give a little extra light on our counters. We have a recessed light fixture in the kitchen, a really bad design left from the eighties, so our counters are shadowed and I like working with good light. These did exactly what I wanted and the remote is great. It also will be helpful for late night trips to the kitchen where you don't want a faceful of light.
customer_reviews.author: Chanel

customer_reviews.title: Great Accent Lighting
customer_reviews.text: Renovating a kitchen and wanted some accent lighting for the tops of my cabinets. Found these with great reviews and purchased 6 lights. Absolutely love them and use them nightly. They have a brightness setting so they can be dimmed and the timer for the lights is a bonus. Comes with a remote that we tuck away in a kitchen drawer for quick access. Would highly recommend them to anyone that is looking for accent lighting not only for a kitchen but throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: Saydie98

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: 1st of all, they must be screwed into the underside of the cabinets since they don’t adhere just by sticking them up. 2nd, the batteries that come with the lights only last a month or slightly more than that. So, I replaced the batteries with expensive batteries and a few months later the lights wouldn’t work with even additional brand new batteries. Either I just got a bad set of lights or they are inherently a cheap product.
customer_reviews.author: Chip C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect accent or emergency lighting
customer_reviews.text: Only had for a week - but so far - so good. Easy to install - with tiny screws or double sided tape. Puts off great light without being glaring. Remote is perfect - love that they can be dimmed. Placed under all kitchen cabinets. Makes me feel safer - especially when the power went out. Only problem is I can't stop playing with them - turning off and on - full brightness and dimming. Going to go thru lots of batteries if I keep this up......
customer_reviews.author: JuJu

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product for adding a little light to an area
customer_reviews.text: My kitchen has very bright lights. When I bring my baby in at night - turning on the kitchen lights wakes me completely up and the baby. I needed a small light that would essentially be easy to turn on and off with one hand, bright but not too bright, and I could keep out of sight. This item did all of that for me. It has a small profile and can easily hide under the lip of a small shelf (out of sight). It’s not too bright, especially since it shines light from above. On & off is clickable (just click the light). Overall a great product (even for a single light)
customer_reviews.author: Jack Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Battery life.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. it is great to have a 'shut-off timer' because most times you do not remember. I am very interested in the battery life & will advise later, so far so good. Also, we are using some of these for accent lighting in a kitchen & we have set the LED's to 50%. for about 15-30 minutes. It's very important every time you turn the lights on to engage the shutdown timer so.....you can keep the MAX battery life. Also, if you are using multiple lights (in the kitchen) you can set the under counter and ceiling lights separately, just remember to always engage the shutdown timer because... you WILL forget to turn them off.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Amazing LED Wireless Lights
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for under my kitchen cabinets after watching several Youtube videos about these lights. I had delayed purchasing any wireless LED lights because I purchased some in the past from Walmart and the light was too harsh - a very cool white and I like warm white lights. These are perfect! I love the remote with all the options for brightness and timers. I totally recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: starsister888

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I love my new under the counter lights! My husband first purchased lights that required drilling into the cabinets because they weren’t wireless. We returned them for wireless lights...a great decision! They can be turned on/off/dimmed by just using the tiny remote. My husband installed them in literally 10-15 minutes before company arrived. Just needed to measure the space so they were all the same distance apart. We used the sticky pads, however, may decide later to use the permanent screws. It was a huge savings after having an estimate from an electrician!
customer_reviews.author: Diane M.

customer_reviews.title: Working as task lighting
customer_reviews.text: So... I prefer not having to buy batteries that end up in landfill. I should have read more about the product before buying. Upon receiving product I decided to try the puck lights to under-light cabinets in a space that is difficult to access. They work quite well as task lighting. The hook and loop tape worked on some of the pucks, but one would not stay put. I sanded the surface and reapplied and that helped to adhere the puck. These came with tiny screws so I'll attempt to attach with those (though I doubt I can access with drill or screwdriver). FYI: this is not a particularly slim puck.
customer_reviews.author: TrykaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Battery HOGS
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, these are great. Batteries in, push a button on the remote and you're in business. I put them on top of our kitchen cabinets for accent lighting. However, a week later they are dimming. 2 weeks in and I have already replaced the batteries in 2 lights (3 AA each). After replacing the batteries, they are 3 times as bright as the others, which are dimming by the day. Prepare to buy a ton of AA batteries with these lights.
customer_reviews.author: A. Zieren

customer_reviews.title: Light & Bright
customer_reviews.text: Living in an older home can sometimes give you challenges that new homes don't. Under counter lighting was never thought of years ago when my house was built. Without an expensive electrician bill I thought I would try these. The price was right so why not. What a surprise. They have surpassed my expectations. I can now read recipes without turning around toward the main lights, I can actually see what I'm cooking. I'm so please....you will be too!!
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Different colors of light. Not consistent.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one set of these lights and was so happy that I ordered two more to complete my kitchen under cabinet lighting. Unfortunately, in the two new sets that arrived, they contained lights with different hues. Some were a cool blue white and others were a very warm yellow light. These did not mix well for my house so I ordered a replacement and they were again not consistent. While the product seemed great at first, I cannot recommend it due to lack of consistency. I’m now returning all three sets and putting the money toward having a professional electrician install proper under cabinet lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for under cabinet lighting!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these to light my counters in the rental house we currently live in and they are perfect! I used the adhesive discs they came with and it's awesome! For some reason I thought that they could all work at the exact same time with the remote, they don't, but the remote does run them all, so it's perfectly fine by me. The batteries will be very easy to replace as well because the entire back stays connected to the surface, think of it like a smoke detector. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Buy them if You Require Under Cabinet Lighting
customer_reviews.text: These are super, terrific lights. Who knew they would be so good! I ordered 2-sets figuring they're probably very dim and I'll need at least 12. Oh my gosh, they are very bright and 6 lamps light up my whole kitchen. The intensity can be lowered (if you purchase the remote, which I did), and they were so easy to install that I couldn't believe it. Normally, everything I purchase, I end up with buyer's remorse. Not this time. I returned the other 6 that I didn't need and the process couldn't possibly have been any easier unless they knocked at my door and picked them up!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Good puck lights
customer_reviews.text: The lights are easy to install, bright, and have good remote control feature. I purchased this for a friend with visual impairment, who has difficulty seeing in the dark. With the lights installed on the hallway walls, she’s able to turn them on with the remote from far away (but directing toward the lights), before navigating toward the lights. Although they did include the adhesive sticker if you don’t mount with nails, I would strongly recommend nailing, since the one I tried adhering with the sticker fell after a few taps on the light. It is definitely more secure mounting with nails. As of now I have not experienced anything negative worth noting, so pretty satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY, they will break.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a lot of these pucks for my shelf display,(over 40) over the past few months I have had to buy new pucks because they keep on breaking down. It's not the battery, the pucks just stop turning on. They all have less than 30 minutes of use, I don't keep them on. They keep on breaking down, I am done replacing them with new ones and will look for a new lighting solution. Do yourself a favor and do not buy these lights, they are faulty. I have over 40 of them and most have broken down and I feel eventually they all will.
customer_reviews.author: CCP

customer_reviews.title: Uses up batteries but works good
customer_reviews.text: Still deciding on whether or not I will continue to use this product. When the batteries are new it is very bright. We use this in a jewelry display which is turned on 4 days a week. After a a week or so they are not as bright. I have already had to replace the batteries after a month. If I have to continue replacing the batteries as often as I do I may look into a hardwire option. If you want to use these for short amount of time like under cabinets or in a bathroom it would be perfect. The lights can be turned on with either the remote or touching the center of the light.
customer_reviews.author: Kalixoxo

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CONCEPT BUT
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea it was great but the implementation left a lot to be desired. They did not stay put kept falling off and yes I did prepare the surface with alcohol to get it ready. I was so excited to get them up but after 2 months they kept falling off and I bought for the ease of installation so in other words I did not want to screw them on. If you are agile and can screw them on they would be OK.
customer_reviews.author: First Timer

customer_reviews.title: amazing! Thats great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on Dec. 5 and received the following day, fast shipping, amazing! Thats great customer service. Now, lets talk about the product. The lights are pretty great, i love the control remote, i love the fact that they are dimmable, also, the timer is a great feauture, i have not used it yet though. Installation was a piece of cake, very easy and fast. My only complaint would be and that is the reason i am giving this product 4 stars is that you can see the puck light sticking out from underneath the cabinet, but i guess that is something i will get used to eventually. Please see photos attached.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak for the motion detection as I haven't set that option up, I just tap the light and instant on. I installed 5 of the 6 under the cabinets in my kitchen and on the cabinet over my sink. They aren't the brightest, but you know that going in by their info sheet. The remote works flawlessly, and is direction based, point at the light or lights you want on and bam they turn on. You can even set a timer or dim them for low light at night for your kids. These work fantastic for the purpose I bought them for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little lights
customer_reviews.text: The light pucks are very easy to setup - you just remove the back, then remove the little plastic battery blocker, replace the back. The included double-sided tape circles work really well to stick the pucks on the under side of cabinets. The included remote works nicely, too, and is quite intuitive to use. As far as brightness is concerned, they are plenty bright for what I am doing with them (under cabinet lighting in the kitchen). I have three of them on the underside of one cabinet that is about 4 feet above the counter. Those three work nicely to illuminate that area. I have one under a typical cabinet, and it is plenty bright.
customer_reviews.author: J. Innis

customer_reviews.title: Great add
customer_reviews.text: Really inexpensive way to add lighting. And they are bright. I wish that the sensor was more sensitive to the remote so that I didn’t have to work so hard to turn them all on. Only a few lights come on at a time rather than all the lights coming on at once
customer_reviews.author: Tn Noelle

customer_reviews.title: These LED lights are as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I love these lights. The pucks don't show because of the moulding under my cabinets, which is what I wanted, but I was afraid with the obstruction that the remote wouldn't work. I was thrilled that it does! The amount of light projected is perfect and looks beautiful reflecting on my granite countertops.. I'm not sure about the battery life since I just installed them, but I'm loving the fact that I didn't have to hire an electrician and pay a small fortune to get the LED lighting I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia H.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: As part of decorating my new house, I wanted hidden LED accent lighting in a few out of reach places. These lights were perfect. They're small enough to place out of sight, the brightness adjusting and timed shutoff features are idea, and one remote controls all of my accent lights, even though they're 9 feet up and completely out of sight. These being battery powered was a plus because the spots they're located have no accessible power outlets.
customer_reviews.author: nfp

customer_reviews.title: Work as expected and so easy to install...........
customer_reviews.text: Used these puck lights for undercabinet task lighting. They are a very useful addition to a kitchen with just one overhead light. They are reasonably priced and come with batteries installed! I have no complaints except I wish they were a little warmer of a light and the lights themselves were a little thinner so that all you notice is the light itself not the fixture. Other than that, I am very happy with my purchase. I just put them up this morning so only time will tell how the 3m sticky tape holds up and how long battery life is. I may write another review at a later date on those results.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after watching the video on the Amazon website. These little guys do not disappoint. I didn't want cords hanging down from under the cabinet lights so after looking at several different kinds/brands I settled on these puck lights. I am glad I did! They are bright, yet you can dim them significantly for ambiance. I was super skeptical of the little remote, but so far, so fabulous! They work in unison and I haven't had any problems. If I do, I will update my review. These little beauties are nearly undetectable under my cabinets but create excellent additional light. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JulzieM

customer_reviews.title: Constantly turn on and off by themselves
customer_reviews.text: These are awful. I’ve had them for almost 2 months and I’ve had to replace the batteries 3 times already because they keep turning on and off by themselves. Also, the adhesive that comes with them doesn’t hold. I had to buy separate adhesive to get them to stick under my kitchen cabinets. They were amazing the first day, but otherwise a complete disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: relbeis

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought them sooner
customer_reviews.text: These are such cool lights. I had ones that you tap to turn on for our kitchen. I took those down and put these up and it was a great decision. The remote controls all 6, but just point it at each light and it will turn on or if two are next to each other, it’ll turn both on. The remote also has a timer and brightness setting. I used some Velcro command strips to put the remote under a cabinet so I won’t loose it. Love these lights and if you’re on the fence, just go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Great super convenient lights
customer_reviews.text: These just arrived yesterday and we had them installed within minutes of opening the package. My sister-in-law recommended them to us. They recently installed them under their new kitchen cabinets and they love them. I put four of them along the ceiling in the closet so I can see my clothes better. They look great and I love the remote and dimming feature. They come with both adhesive and screws. We used the adhesive and had them up and working with the remote in 5 minutes tops, including getting the ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Lucysue900

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Evolution Wireless LED Puck Light 6 Pack with Remote Control work great
customer_reviews.text: We have a pantry with no lights in it and my wife finally got fed up and gave the word to the handyman she keeps around (that's me). It doesn't warrant rewiring for lighting, so I ordered these to try. They all worked perfect, so I installed them, put the remote on the inside door casing and it lights up the whole place. A word of caution, don't waste time using just tape , because they will fall down, use the screws too and you'll have a happy wife......at least for awhile anyway.
customer_reviews.author: danboy202

customer_reviews.title: Not the best light output and chews through batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Good points: - easy to stick up almost anywhere - the remote works quite well. Bad points: - the light isn't that great (common with other small LED lights this will NOT give you the same light output as an incandescent bulb). - chews through batteries. All it takes is leaving it on one night, and that's soon 18 (each light takes 3) batteries you'll be replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Witty Username

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic But
customer_reviews.text: I like the pod lights they have the option of remote on and off, brightness adjustment or manually on and off along with the option of using screws or two sided sticking tape. 2 of the lights i used screws the other 4 I used the tape. The only thing I am disappointed with is one of the pod lights has drained 6 batteries of power in just a few hours and this light is one of two over my kitchen sink. 😪😭😪😭
customer_reviews.author: Butch A

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I rated a 4 star for brightness, because they aren't made to be bright like your regular traditional lightbulbs. They look brighter on the site however, these give off more of a warm bright Christmas light look, not a 75 wattage, so I wouldn't suggest using them for a vanity setup. Giving how bright they are I'll say around 50 watts. They're actually work perfect for in my half bath. I love the extra features with the remote control.
customer_reviews.author: Lyrica

customer_reviews.title: Love these things!
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. Batteries come pre-installed in the lights. All you have to do is pull out a little clear Tab and then put the cover back on. Circle stickies are included with the lights as well. Super easy to install and setup. Just make sure you put the little Wi-Fi symbol facing outwards towards your room. That helps the lights received the signal from the remote. Remote works great, lights are pretty bright and this is well worth $35. My kitchen be pimping now!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Salkeld

customer_reviews.title: Good closet lights
customer_reviews.text: Great for dark closets -- not so good as under counter lighting. These are handy, but not very bright. For me they are useful in dark places like closets or as a handy bathroom cabinet light. Under counters in the kitchen these are relatively dim and the illumination isn't that wide. Remote works, timer works, easy to install. Would I recommend them? Qualified yes. If you want unwired, easily placed light -- go for it. If you want BRIGHT illumination look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Jim from White Plains

customer_reviews.title: Great lighting fix!
customer_reviews.text: Love these little lights! My kitchen doesn’t have a window, so it lacks lighting. Added these & they instantly brought extra light in. The battery life isn’t the best. I find myself changing the batteries often. Even by the time of this photo, the lights aren’t as bright as they should be, as the batteries need to be replaced. I would recommend for the price point, but I would spend more money for lights that don’t require batteries. Installation was easy though. I initially installed with the sticky tabs, but that didn’t last. So I installed with the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Kee Kee

customer_reviews.title: $18 a month on batteries? No thanks.
customer_reviews.text: While they are really bright and easy to install, be prepared to change out the batteries every month. I wait until I can barely see then change them because I don't want to spend an extra $18 a month on batteries. I'll be replacing with a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Audio Gal

customer_reviews.title: Puck Lights with Extras
customer_reviews.text: After looking at puck lights in various places, I decided on this purchase because the price was good compared to buying them a couple at a time. Also, I was intrigued by the remote and dimming capabilities. Received the lights on time, all the batteries were already installed, and sticking them to the underside of my cabinets couldn't be easier. The remote works great! You can dim the lights by 50% and also incrementally with the plus and minus buttons. You can set the lights to go off in 15, 30, 60, and 120 minutes. Very happy with the quality of the product and the added features.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Shingler

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited upon receiving these lights which I wanted to use under my kitchen cabinets for brightness at night, however...either my lights were defective or it’s just the way they are made, but I was surprised to learn that even with the given options brightness settings all ranges about the same, the brightness barely changes, especially with the amount of batteries required for each one, I’m actually appalled to have paid as much as i did for a product that doesn’t even work and only having this product for less than 2 weeks, it’s already failing on me. I’m extremely disappointed and wish I went with something else. Wouldn’t recommend at all, save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Don't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in August, you can only return them for a month. By mid-October 2 of the 6 had quit working. Now in December, not a single one of them still works. Tried replacing the batteries and still nothing. They were hung upside down in my kitchen as under counter lighting. We used the remote to turn them on and off so they wouldn't be "man-handled" too much. A lot of good that did us. I really liked them at first, but now I just have 6 useless pieces of plastic. I will have to replace them with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: GMyers

customer_reviews.title: Great addition w/o the Hassle of Wiring
customer_reviews.text: These lights have worked out perfectly. From providing light at 5am to pour that first cup of coffee to helping us see what we are doing while preparing a late night supper: these lights are performing perfectly. Now as the summer light fades we will be using them even more. The fact that you can tap the lens on an individual light or use the remote to turn them all on or off is great.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bedell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install and Work Great
customer_reviews.text: The Wireless Puck lights are terrific. I installed them using the enclosed double sided tape under my cabinets in the kitchen. These cabinets are over a counter top creating a very dark space. I put three puck lights about 12" apart and they provide adequate light for me to read recipes, directions, etc. I installed the other 3 lights over my workbench in the garage and again, they provide good lighting for my small projects. I'm very pleased with these lights and they are hard to beat for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Coreman

customer_reviews.title: What is this?!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 11 of these things in the past 4 or 5 months and they are stuck on with the included adhesive. I've also bought 32 rechargeable batteries along with their chargers, which cost more than the actual lights. I only use them for nice kitchen and hall lighting when I have company. I don't have a lot of company, hence they don't get used much. Two already don't work. I thought it was the batteries, but nope. They don't work. If this is normal, this is a gimmick as I have to keep buying more due to the bases being stuck to the bottoms of cabinets. Very, very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Easily turn on with slight noise draining the batteries. I brought these because they came with the remote to control the lighting. However a slight noise like a door closing they turn on. I have a house full of kids and dogs and I placed them inside the bedroom walk in closet, under a kitchen counter and any little noise and they would turn on. I had to constantly keep turning them off. The ones in my closet batteries lasted last a week as I didn’t realize they turned on until the next day. Just too much work and quite annoying, the rest I have in the box and had to take the batteries out so those don’t drain.
customer_reviews.author: Jeepfan

customer_reviews.title: The remote came with a bonus feature
customer_reviews.text: The lights themselves work fine, but why does the remote for the lights also affect my TV's HDMI splitter???? I have a light placed close to my TV, and I can't turn it on/off without the HDMI splitter also shutting on/off at the same time. The splitter itself doesn't even have an on/off function, and yet this remote for a completely unrelated product is able to shut it down? This is the most amazing product I've ever purchased on Amazon, and I don't mean it as a compliment.
customer_reviews.author: mingzl8106

customer_reviews.title: Best invention ever
customer_reviews.text: We remodeled our kitchen. I placed these underneath our cabinets to have area lighting when working at any part of our counter space. Love the remote. Love that they are dimmable. We also use one at night for a night light. You cannot see them under our cabinets. Adds perfect lighting where needed. Soooo easy to put on and off without remote as well. Highly, highly recommed this product. I used the stick up pads to adhere to cabinets and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to wiring in under cabinet lights
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before purchasing, so I was hopeful, and I was not disappointed! They arrived quickly and were really easy to set up (nice that all the batteries came with). The adhesive pads worked great and I had the lights in place in no time (under my kitchen cabinets). The remote is the neat part, and makes using the under counter lights really easy. Nice to able to set the brightness - have not yet played with the timer functions. Overall, excellent quality and value.
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Lighting, Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: I bought these lights to put in a china cabinet I inherited from my grandmother. They were extremely easy to install and the directions were simple and direct. The remote control is a fantastic feature with its multiple controls - timers and level of brightness adjustments - giving the lights a lot of versatility and ease of use. The lights are a great value gor the price paid. I would highly recommend these lights!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Weirauch

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, I'll update in about a month but really liking these puck lights so far. My kitchen is in a U shape and I positioned sensor outward so I usually have to rotate in the kitchen and point the remote at each puck light to get them to turn on. I should have installed with sensor turned towards opening of kitchen instead of directly out. I don't mind though because once they're on, they look great. Again, I'll update on battery life in about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad screws but lights work well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these with the intention of screw mounting them. The screws that came with them were ridiculous! They wouldn’t hold a tissue! I used my own screws. The area of drywall didn’t need anchors but I had them ready. I placed my own sticker marker on the base to assure alignment for the remote. Once mounted, the lights and remote worked well. I can’t comment on battery life yet as it hasn’t been but a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: petitfour

customer_reviews.title: Very useful product
customer_reviews.text: I placed these in various closets using the screws for attaching to drywall and the sticky tape for the backs of the sliding doors. Works very well for that purpose and so far the batteries have lasted for several hours. The tape is very strong and will damage the surface if you try to remove them so beware. I do not use the remote, so cannot comment on it. Just give them a tap to turn on and off. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Let there be light ! Great product.
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for any area that could use a bit of light. I purchased them for my Dad's room at his Senior Care Home. The room is well lit, but the closet was very dark, 2 lights placed inside did the trick ! My 4 year old grand daughter watched me put them up, ( in less than a minute ) , and declared she would like one in her room as a night light, and she loves it. Couldn't be easier to install, arrived promptly and in perfect condition. Thank you to seller London Johnson ! Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Another Debbie in California

customer_reviews.title: THESE ARE A MUST HAVE!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolutely genius! It has a remote but the coolest part is if you put some lights other places in the room, you can adjust just those! It is so awesome!!! Ordering more because they install super easy and they are so great! Oh, and we pit some on the ceiling!! They work as a sort of can light but no cutting in the wall or wiring! Fabulous!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Lang

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These don’t turn on with motion detection, not sure that applies. Awesome addition to existing cabinetry without having to run electrical. Brightness and adjustment are great. Nice chrisp cool color. Remote doesn’t reach all of them over a large spread and is easy to lose. See my review on the replacement remote...hahaha
customer_reviews.author: Liquidonyx

product_meta.title: Brilliant Evolution LED Puck Light 6 Pack with Remote | Wireless LED Under Cabinet Lighting | Under Counter Lights for Kitchen | Battery Operated Lights | Under Cabinet Light | Battery Powered Lights
feature_bullets: 55 LUMENS – Our long-lasting LED puck lights shine brighter with a 55 lumen, 3000K warm white glow. This LED under cabinet lighting will illuminate any area of your home. The LEDs never need to be replaced

WIRELESS REMOTE – The remote control lights include a dimmer, an optional auto off timer and on/off capabilities for convenient control of your lights. The included wireless remote will allow you to control up to 12 puck lights up to 15 feet away
SELECTABLE DIMMER - Select your desired level of brightness or press the 50% or 100% brightness button on the wireless remote
OPTIONAL AUTO OFF TIMER - Set the under cabinet lights to turn OFF with the optional timer in 15, 30, 60 or 120 minutes to converse battery life

100 HOUR RUN TIME – Each of our battery operated lights last up to 4 times longer than other puck lights on 3 AA batteries (18 included). Simply replace the batteries by twisting the light off of its base and insert new batteries

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars10,112 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
